so what's the hybrid IT challenge and

it was driven by the line of business in

maybe a
b pc and AWS and then coming into the

we come down to it there's kind of three
myths that are associated with IT one
that applications are well documented
because we know we think we documented
well but no not so much the other part

idea of how these services all work
together and more often than not they
have no clue quite honestly I was
reading an article earlier this year
that was talking about a application I

don't understand how these services all

generally happy with the IT services
more often than not they're complaining

we're having problems I can't connect
and these are all challenges for IT to

well in many ways the traditional
approach has been to leverage machine
data to go ahead and provide this
perspective I can look at my logs I can
look at my nibs I can have agents there
looking at the activity but more often
than not those are only really looking
at what's happening inside of that
workload of that server it's not really
looking at what's happening in terms of
tying these things together and we talk
about complexity when we start to have
micro-services into the mix and I take
what had been the traditional
application server that maybe had seven
or eight processes that we're all
working together break them into micro
services and now I have five six seven
maybe ten servers they're all running a
micro service to deliver this
application the dependency upon the
network is huge and that's where we come
into play is really looking at it from
the perspective of wire data and bring
wire data into the conversation to be
able to understand how these devices are
communicating to each other and we do
that using something that we call
adaptive service intelligence or ASI an
ASI provides us the ability to measure
key performance indicators associated
with the way that the application is
performing what the user experience is
what the responsiveness is what kind of
errors are they getting Oracle puts out
nearly 64,000 errors on the wire we can
see those errors and often hand off that
information directly to the DBA to solve
the problem quickly these are the kind
of things that you can derive from the
wire and understand how these things all
interconnect together and then as we
were talking about the idea of a service
the service isn't simply the
implementation of the application it's
also having all the subtending
applications that come along Active
Directory DNS and the like they all have
to work together to deliver the service
so what we've done and in particular
when we take a look at the cloud we've

and disaggregate that and bring it into

the product that we call ingenious one

we want to understand what's happening
